intro: Reseda media var. intermedia, commonly known as intermediate reseda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Reseda media var. intermedia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
